revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: Neilos and Sarapammon, farmers of the tax on catoecic registry for the Oxyrhynchite and other nomes, through their agent, Nepotianos also called Apollonios, [l. 4] to Orgineia, citizen, daughter of Marcus . . . Niger and Demetria, daughter of Sarapodoros, through Apollonios also called Didymos, son of Apollonios, grandson of Dioskoros, of the Sosicosmian tribe and Althean deme, greetings. [l. 8] You have paid to us as taxes on the 26 1/2 catoecic arouras in the neighborhood of Pela in the allotment of Diodoros son of Demokrates, which you have received in cession through the [l. 12] record-bureau in Pachon of the past 3rd yr. from Tbekis, daughter of Pausiris and Kollauchis, from Pela, the one hundred eighteen drachmas owed, including a gratuity in money, total 118 dr. Year 4 of the Emperor Caesar Lucius [l. 16] Septimius Severus Pius Pertinax Augustus Arabicus Adiabenicus, Phamenoth 20.

listBibl.bibl: P.Princ. III 131 SB XVI 12642 BL IX, 288; L. C. Youtie, "Receipt for telos katalochismon. P.Princ. III 131 Revised," ZPE 38 (1980): 277-280
